As an AI language model, I can provide some insight into this topic based on current trends.

TikTok has indeed become a popular platform for promoting small businesses and entrepreneurship. TikTok's algorithm has helped small businesses increase their reach and engagement with their target audience. The platform's younger users are receptive to entrepreneurial messages, which has made it an effective channel for promoting brand awareness and driving sales.

In addition, TikTok offers several advertising features for businesses to reach their target audience, including in-feed ads, branded lenses, and custom hashtags. These advertising features help small businesses to extend their reach and engagement beyond their organic audience.

Given these trends, promoting small businesses and entrepreneurship on TikTok will likely continue to grow. With its younger audience and algorithmic system, it will remain an effective channel for raising brand awareness and driving sales. In light of the COVID-19 pandemic, where small businesses suffered considerable losses, TikTok's role in promoting entrepreneurship and small businesses has become more critical, making it a valuable channel for small business owners to reach their targeted audience.
